application_type_full: Outline planning permission: All matters reserved
borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:11pt">The development, by virtue of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">lack of defensible space in front of the dwelling, its positioning and its poor access approach, </span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">does not provide any natural protection or natural surveillance between the dwelling and the access road and hardstanding area in front of the lock up garages and as such would be susceptible to crime by reason of its siting away from the road, contrary to:</span></p><ul><li>The National Planning Policy Framework (July, 2021)</li><li>Policy D11 of the London Plan (March, 2021)</li><li>Policies BC7 BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document (2011) (DPD)</li><li>Policy SP2 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham Draft London Plan Regulation 19 Consultation Version (September 2020)</li></ul><p><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The development does not provide adequate pedestrian access arrangements to the dwelling, which is accessible only via a private service road and has no direct connection to the public realm. There is no pedestrian footpath,</span><span style="font-size:11pt">&nbsp;resulting in the potential for pedestrian and vehicular conflict. The proposal is therefore considered to be prejudicial to pedestrian and vehicular safety and as such contrary</span><span style="font-size:11pt">&nbsp;to:</span></p><ul><li>The National Planning Policy Framework (July, 2021)</li><li>Policies D11 and D4 of the London Plan (March, 2021)</li><li>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Barking and Dagenham Core Strategy (2010)</li><li>Policies BR10 and BR11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document (2011) (DPD)</li><li>Policy SP2 and DMD1 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham Draft London Plan Regulation 19 Consultation Version (September 2020)</li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The development, by reason of its form, scale, siting and location will result in unacceptable visual harm, loss of outlook, overlooking and loss of privacy detrimental to the amenities enjoyed by nearby residential occupiers, in particular numbers 2 and 4 Ashton Gardens, contrary to:</span></p><ul><li>The National Planning Policy Framework (July, 2021)</li><li>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March, 2021)</li><li>PolicyCP3 of the Barking and Dagenham Core Strategy (2010)</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document (2011) (DPD)</li><li>Policy SP2 and DMD1 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham Draft London Plan Regulation 19 Consultation Version (September 2020)</li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The principle of the proposed development in a private rear garden is inappropriate; the development would be isolated and out of character, would not address the street frontage or resemble the pattern of development or be in character with the appearance of the dwellings in Ashton Gardens and therefore fails to protect the character and amenity of the local area contrary to:</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">The National Planning Policy Framework (July, 2021)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies GG2, H2, D3 and D4 of the London Plan (March, 2021)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Barking and Dagenham Core Strategy (2010)</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt"> Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document (2011) (DPD)</span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy SP2 and DMD1 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham Draft London Plan Regulation 19 Consultation Version (September 2020)<br></span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;</span></li></ul>
description: Outline Planning Permission with all matters reserved, for the demolition of an existing garage and the construction of a two storey 2 bedroom dwelling to the rear of 2 Ashton gardens.
